goals.question: What is the distribution of population in London?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of population in London and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: What is the average rent in different boroughs of London?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average rent per borough
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the average rent in different boroughs of London and identify any significant differences.

goals.question: What is the relationship between population and number of crimes in London?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of population vs number of crimes
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between population and number of crimes in London.

goals.question: What is the distribution of green spaces in London?
goals.visualization: Map of green spaces in London
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of green spaces in London and identify any areas with low green space coverage.

goals.question: What is the distribution of ethnic groups in London?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of ethnic groups in London
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the diversity of ethnic groups in London and identify any significant differences in representation.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='population', kde=True)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population in London?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='borough', y='average_rent', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the average rent in different boroughs of London?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='population', y='number_of_crimes')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the relationship between population and number of crimes in London?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import geopandas as gpd
import contextily as ctx

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(data.longitude, data.latitude))
    gdf = gdf.to_crs(epsg=3857)
    
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = gdf.plot(ax=plt.gca(), markersize=5, color='green', alpha=0.5)
    ctx.add_basemap(ax, source=ctx.providers.Stamen.TonerLite)
    ax.set_axis_off()
    plt.title("What is the distribution of green spaces in London?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data['ethnic_group'].value_counts().plot.pie(autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of ethnic groups in London?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
